ca.benow.transmission
Class TransmissionClient

java.lang.Object
  ca.benow.transmission.TransmissionClient

public class TransmissionClient
extends java.lang.Object

The main class for interacting with transmission. Create an instance with appropriate parameters and call the methods. If possible, re-use the instance to avoid slight network overhead.

Here's an example. 

 // initialize log4j
 DOMConfigurator.configure("etc/logging.xml");
 
 TransmissionClient client = new TransmissionClient(new URL(
                "http://transmission:transmission@localhost:9091/transmission/rpc"));
 List<TorrentStatus> torrents = client.getAllTorrents();
 for (TorrentStatus curr : torrents)
        System.out.println(curr);
By tuning the log4j config, it is possible to see the JSON RPC request and response text, which might be useful for debugging.

Author:
andy

TransmissionClient

public TransmissionClient(java.net.URL url)
Creates a new client that connects to a given url. URL should be something similar to 
 http://transmission:transmission@localhost:9091/transmission/rpc

Parameters:

sendCommand

public JSONObject sendCommand(java.lang.String name,
                              JSONObject args)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              TransmissionException
Send a command to Transmission.

Parameters:
name - name of command, which forms the 'method' in request
args - arguments which for body of 'arguments' in request
Returns:
json object containing result of 'arguments' in response, if any
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on problem communicating
TransmissionException - on Transmission problem when performing the command

                                                 TorrentStatus.TorrentField[] requestedFields)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Get status of torrents

Parameters:
ids - optional ids of torrents to fetch status for, if not given, status for all torrents will be fetched
requestedFields - information fields to fetch, if not given, only the id and name fields are fetched
Returns:
status for requested torrents
Throws:
java.io.IOException

public AddedTorrentInfo addTorrent(java.lang.String downloadDir,
                                   java.lang.String torrentFileNameOrURL,
                                   boolean paused,
                                   int peerLimit,
                                   int bandwidthPriority,
                                   int[] filesWanted,
                                   int[] filesUnwanted,
                                   int[] priorityHigh,
                                   int[] priorityLow,
                                   int[] priorityNormal)
                            throws java.io.IOException
Adds a new torrent by name or url

Parameters:
downloadDir - path to download the torrent to
torrentFileNameOrURL - local filename or url to torrent
paused - if true, don't start the torrent
peerLimit - maximum number of peers
bandwidthPriority - one of the PRIORITY_* constants
filesWanted - indices of file(s) to download
filesUnwanted - indices of file(s) to not download
priorityHigh - indices of high-priority file(s)
priorityLow - indices of low-priority file(s)
priorityNormal - indices of normal-priority file(s)
Returns:
info about added torrent
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setTorrents

public void setTorrents(java.lang.Object[] ids,
                        int bandwidthPriority,
                        int downloadLimit,
                        boolean downloadLimited,
                        int[] filesWanted,
                        int[] filesUnwanted,
                        boolean honorsSessionLimits,
                        java.lang.String location,
                        int peerLimit,
                        int[] priorityHigh,
                        int[] priorityLow,
                        int[] priorityNormal,
                        int seedIdleLimit,
                        int seedIdleMode,
                        double seedRatioLimit,
                        int seedRatioMode,
                        java.lang.String[] trackerAdd,
                        int[] trackerRemove,
                        TrackerPair[] trackerReplace,
                        int uploadLimit,
                        boolean uploadLimited)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Sets properties of selected torrents

Parameters:
ids - numerical ids, string hashes or the ID_RECENTLY_ADDED constant. If null all ids will be affected
bandwidthPriority - this torrent's bandwidth tr_priority_t
downloadLimit - maximum download speed (KBps)
downloadLimited - true if "downloadLimit" is honored
filesWanted - indices of file(s) to download. Empty array for all indices.
filesUnwanted - indices of file(s) to not download. Empty array for all indices.
honorsSessionLimits - true if session upload limits are honored
location - new location of the torrent's content
peerLimit - maximum number of peers
priorityHigh - indices of high-priority file(s). Empty array for all indices.
priorityLow - indices of low-priority file(s). Empty array for all indices.
priorityNormal - indices of normal-priority file(s). Empty array for all indices.
seedIdleLimit - torrent-level number of minutes of seeding inactivity
seedIdleMode - which seeding inactivity to use. See tr_inactvelimit
seedRatioLimit - torrent-level seeding ratio
seedRatioMode - which ratio to use. See tr_ratiolimit
trackerAdd - strings of announce URLs to addd
trackerRemove - ids of trackers to remove
trackerReplace - pairs of
uploadLimit - maximum upload speed (KBps)
uploadLimited - true if "uploadLimit" is honored
Throws:
java.io.IOException
